New Records: West Indies set a new unwanted record of 51 dot balls - the most any team has registered in a T20 World Cup when posting a score of at least 180.
Key Match Events: Phil Salt scored 87 not out to lead England to an 8-wicket win over West Indies.
Jonny Bairstow scored 48 not out to support Salt's innings.
Rovman Powell hit 36, and Nicholas Pooran scored 32 for West Indies.
Jofra Archer took 3 wickets for 22 runs, including the wicket of Nicholas Pooran.
Adil Rashid took 1 wicket for 21 runs, including the wicket of Andre Russell.
Pre-Game Insights: England opted to chase after winning the toss.
West Indies got off to a strong start, scoring 72 runs in the first 8 overs.
Post-Match Reflections: Phil Salt said he was 'happier than ever' to have Jonny Bairstow take the pressure off him with calculated risks.
Jonny Bairstow said he had to be the better batsman after Jos Buttler got out.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played on a fine batting deck at the Daren Sammy National Stadium.
England's win marked a strong start to their Super Eight campaign in the T20 World Cup 2024.
Jofra Archer's performance has been impressive, with an economy rate of 6.58 and 6 wickets in the tournament so far.
